text: man oh man what a busy week for this guy you guys have sent me so much material to take a look at asking me to explore these different thesis and hypothesis and cycles that people think may or may not be happening and I've been spending dozens of hours consuming and trying to understand and synthesize the data set so I was watching the video from Biggy Smalls from Reddit I've been watching a bunch of different Richard Newton's video I got one pulled up right now and man like how fun is the puzzle I'm having a blast from somebody like me that's been in markets for so long like I'm I'm in my 17th year of trading finding really interesting things like this to try to dissect is very entertaining for me it's just a cool thought exercise to run through so what I'm working on now is actually a model that takes the different rule sets that they're outlining in terms of their assessment of when a cycle kicks off and some of the different things that might um emerge over the course of a cycle and seeing if we can project forward any of it because the guys are doing a great job specifically trying to stay as objective as possible nobody's like pontificating this is what's happening most of them are saying things like if this is the case if this is true which is massive that's really important for you people that watch

text: that's a thing as well so when I am looking at this chain I'm seeing a ton of really far outof the- money options now this becomes really really important if big if if GameStop starts Rising like crazy if GameStop starts flying up this creates massive buying demand from market makers because here's the deal right now even for these right here for example there's 14,600 volume at the 30s it looks like and they're only a 21 Delta so right now the market makers aren't super incentivized to carry a full hedge they probably maybe useing synthetics the way that they do their business is obviously discreet to them I don't know but we know kind of the general approaches that they will take what we do know is that there's no incentive for them to have 100 shares in their account to cover this 21 Delta position we know that the reason why it becomes really interesting if there's a big price increase is because as these get closer to at the money the market makers need to accumulate more shares unless they can internalize the order meaning provide from their own inventory that creates buying pressure the more that that happens the more that they have to hedge this is exactly what a gamma squeeze is that's the primary differentiator between a gamma squeeze and a short squeeze is a gamma squeeze is driven by market maker activities they're just trying to hedge their position to

text: the more that that happens the more that they have to hedge this is exactly what a gamma squeeze is that's the primary differentiator between a gamma squeeze and a short squeeze is a gamma squeeze is driven by market maker activities they're just trying to hedge their position to capture the bidas spread and go home with the money that they made on the spread but in order to do that they need to get rid of and scrub off the excess risk because the thing is for options that are further in the money especially you know like 60 Delta plus they already have most of the position if not all of it hedged especially as it gets closer to expiration but for these out of the monies they're not at that point because they're more likely than not going to expire out of the money but if for whatever reason there's a catalyst that starts driving price then they're forced to start hedging these in a really short-term time frame that is where things start to get very interesting does that mean that's going to happen this week we have no idea yet we literally have no idea yet when I take a look at the price action overall in GameStop take a look let me get my head out of the way take a look at the volume it's just become a neic and the other thing I find interesting is the amount of sale volume

text: the calls side VA or both of them in conjunction which is probably even more likely the case in this scenario because we saw both the put and calls side Val for the far out of the monies jack up into the expiration this past week the other thing I want to keep a really close eye on is the order flow so I have a bunch of different alerts and scans set to track both large orders and total flow so that one I can see if any anomalous purchasing starts occurring or two if there's any big pricing opportunities that emerge from what we're seeing so far at least that's what we got for today if there's any questions or anything else that I should follow up with let me know I love seeing what you guys are sending me so any of these different videos post anything like that that you think is worth taking a look at let me know because again I've said it a million times you guys know this stuff way better than I do I am getting caught up I know options really well that's my space but getting into all the lore and the background behind this product and the history behind it is kind of what I am in the drinking from the fire hose phase getting caught up as fast as I can all right you guys be an outlier enjoy your weekend see youall later
